availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas "Jones" Gregory (Graves County, KY, farmer & 1st lieut 20th KY Inf, capt 1st Reg Cap Grds, guerrilla hunter USA)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Farmer in Graves County in 1860. Served in the 20th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from January 6, 1862, to February 5, 1862. Farmer in Graves County in 1863. Served in the 1st Regiment Capital Guards, Paducah Battalion, as captain from June 24, 1864, to February 12, 1865. Served as captain of a guerrilla hunting unit in March 1865. Killed by guerrillas in Hickman County, Kentucky, in March 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 268.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Graves County, KY, June 1863, p. 31.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 54, 765.
Berry Craig, Kentucky Confederates: Secession, Civil War, and the Jackson Purchase (Lexington: The University Press of Kentucky, 2014), 287-88.
Find A Grave, "Thomas Jones Gregory (1826-1865)," Memorial #84019262, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84019262 (accessed March 2, 2020).
